Class Projectile

java.lang.Object
objects.Projectile
public class Projectile extends Object
Represents a projectile fired by a unit or turret in the game.

Projectiles travel towards a target and deal damage upon impact. They handle their own movement logic and hit detection in the tick() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • Projectile

      public Projectile(double startX, double startY, double speed, int damage, Attackable target, String imagePath, boolean isCritical)
      Initializes the fields according to given parameters and sets hit to false.
      Parameters:
      startX - The beginning X-Coordinate of the projectile.
      startY - The beginning Y-Coordinate of the projectile.
      speed - The speed of the projectile.
      damage - The damage deal to target of the projectile.
      target - The target which projectile is heading toward to.
      imagePath - The image file of projectile.
      isCritical - The status which projectile deals critical damage or not.

    • Projectile

      public Projectile(double startX, double startY, double speed, int damage, Attackable target, String imagePath)
      Legacy constructor for backward compatibility or non-critical projectiles.

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Updates the projectile's state for a single game tick.

      This method moves the projectile toward its target. If the target no longer exists or is no longer alive, the projectile is marked as a hit and stops updating. The destination point is determined based on the target type:

      • If the target is a Unit, the projectile aims toward the unitâ€™s approximate center.
      • If the target is a Base, the projectile aims toward the visual center of the base structure, adjusting for attack direction.
      The projectile advances toward the computed position based on its speed and snaps to the target location when it reaches or surpasses the remaining distance.
